summary: REQ-1 appears implemented by changing backend register() to return null instead of trapping when caller is non-guest. REQ-2 is not evidenced in the diff: the frontend constants and shown code do not include/route to the required friendly ALREADY_REGISTERED message, and there is no visible logic mapping the backend re-registration signal to that message.

missing_requirements.requirement: Update frontend registration error handling so re-registration attempts show the friendly message `This account is already registered. Please sign in instead.` (AUTH_MESSAGES.ALREADY_REGISTERED) and never display the raw backend trap text.
missing_requirements.reason: The modified auth message constants do not define AUTH_MESSAGES.ALREADY_REGISTERED, and the provided AuthProvider diff portion does not show any logic mapping a null/Unauthorized re-registration signal to that friendly message.

hallucinated_features.description: Expanded/changed auth messaging set (e.g., LOGIN_NOT_AVAILABLE, BACKEND_NOT_READY, CONNECTION_TIMEOUT, etc.) unrelated to the re-registration/Unauthorized-trap fix.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest only asks to ensure already-registered re-signup shows the existing friendly message and to avoid showing the raw trap text; it does not request adding/updating other auth/connection messages.

hallucinated_features.description: Additional AuthProvider session initialization/validation defensive logic (validateSession existence checks, timeouts/connection error handling paths).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest does not request changes to session restore/validateSession logic; it is scoped to registration re-try error handling and backend register behavior.
